explanation: Agent A is correct. The macro LFS_LOCK(cfg) expands to ((void)cfg,0), so the assignment int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields 0 at run time. Consequently the controlling expression if (err) is invariant (always false). MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 forbids invariant controlling expressions, and none of the two listed exceptions (infinite-loop invariants or the specific do-while false constant case) apply here. Therefore the reported violation of Rule 14.3 is valid.
